gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT11 - As Sb AP - Profiles from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Depth profiles for arsenic and antimony speciation and alkaline phosphatase activity Dataset Description: <p>Data for the concentrations of the dissolved (&lt;0.4 micromole) arsenic species: total inorganic As (III+V),<br /><!--0--> <!--0--> <!--0--> <!--0--> <!--0--> <!--0--> arsenite (AsIII), monomethyl As, dimethyl As, dissolved antimony species: total inorganic<br />Sb(III+V) and Sb(III), and the activity of the enzyme alkaline phosphatase (unfiltered) for depth<br />profiles from Stations 1, 3, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 16, 22, and 24.</p><p>Please note that some US GEOTRACES data may not be final, pending intercalibration results and further analysis. If you are interested in following changes to US GEOTRACES NAT data, there is an RSS feed available via the BCO-DMO <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066">US GEOTRACES project page</a> (scroll down and expand the "Datasets" section).</p> Acquisition Description: <p>The GEOTRACES carousel cannot take samples from the upper ca. 30 m due to contamination from the ship,&nbsp; therefore samples at depths shallower than 30 meters were collected using a towed fish immediately after station departure.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926423 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0926423
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926092 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0926092

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31603.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31604.rdf Name: station Units: text Description: station; provided by PI in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31605.rdf Name: date Units: YYYYMMDD Description: Date http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31606.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude (South is negative) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31607.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude (West is negative) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31608.rdf Name: AsIII Units: nmol/L Description: Arsenite (HAsO32-) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31609.rdf Name: TAs Units: nmol/L Description: Total inorganic arsenic (AsIII+V) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31610.rdf Name: MMAs Units: nmol/L Description: Monomethyl arsenic http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31611.rdf Name: DMAs Units: nmol/L Description: Dimethyl arsenic http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31612.rdf Name: AP_Turnover_Rate Units: h-1 Description: Alkaline phosphatase turnover rate http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31613.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: dimensionless Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31614.rdf Name: SbIII Units: nanomoles/liter Description: Antimony +3 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31615.rdf Name: TSb Units: nanomoles/liter Description: Total inorganic antimony (SbIII + V) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31616.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: depth of sample; provided by PI in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31862.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Previously named 'GeoTraces_ID', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32963.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Previously named 'event', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33022.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33023.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33024.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33025.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33026.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33028.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.ssZ Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name
PI-supplied Description: station; provided by PI in original data submission.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Date; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Arsenite (HAsO32-); General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Total inorganic arsenic (AsIII+V); General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Monomethyl arsenic; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Dimethyl arsenic; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Alkaline phosphatase turnover rate; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde); General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.
PI-supplied Description: Antimony +3; General Description: Antimony +3
PI-supplied Description: Total inorganic antimony (SbIII + V); General Description: Total inorganic antimony (SbIII+V)

PI-supplied Description: depth of sample; provided by PI in original data submission.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Previously named 'GeoTraces_ID', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Previously named 'event', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>The GEOTRACES carousel cannot take samples from the upper ca. 30 m due to contamination from the ship,&nbsp; therefore samples at depths shallower than 30 meters were collected using a towed fish immediately after station departure.</p>

<p>Filtered (0.4 microm) water samples from the Geotraces Carousel/GO-FLO bottles were placed into<br />500 mL Teflon FEP bottles, refrigerated, and analyzed within 24 hours of collection. Arsenic and<br />antimony speciation determined using selective hydride generation, liquid nitrogen-cooled<br />trapping, and then revolatilization and determination with gas chromatography/photoionization detection (Cutter et al., 1991; Cutter and Cutter, 2006).</p><p>Calibration performed daily via the standard additions method, with a minimum of 4 additions of AsIII, AsV, MMAs, or DMAs depending on the analyses. The slope from the linear fit to these data was then applied to all samples for that day. Detection limits were 25 pmol/L for As(III) and As(III+V), and 50 pmol/L for MMAs and DMAs. Precision was better than 8% (relative standard deviation) for all As species. Alkaline phosphatase samples were taken unfiltered from the ODF rosette bottles (Ra, Th, and pigment hydrocasts) and placed into 500 ml polythylene bottles, then the enzyme activity was measured using the fluorescence method of Ammerman (1993).</p><p>Samples analyzed in duplicate or triplicate and means computed.<br /><br />Related files and references:&nbsp;<br />Ammerman, J. W. 1993. Microbial cycling of inorganic and organic phosphorus in the water<br />column. In: Handbook of Methods in Microbial Ecology (P. Kemp, B. Sherr, E. Sherr, and J. Cole,<br />Eds.), Lewis, Florida, pp. 649-660.<br /><br />Cutter, L.S., G.A. Cutter, and M.L.C. San Diego-McGlone. 1991. Simultaneous determination&nbsp;&nbsp; of<br />inorganic arsenic and antimony species in natural waters using selective hydride generation<br />with gas chromatography/photoionization detection. Anal. Chem. 63:1138-1142.<br /><br />Cutter, G.A. and L.S. Cutter. 2006. The biogeochemistry of arsenic and antimony in the North<br />Pacific Ocean. Geochem. Geophys. Geosystems (G3), 7, Q05M08, doi:10.1029/2005GC001159.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: towed undulating vehicle Instrument Name: towed undulating vehicle Instrument Short Name:TUV Instrument Description: A towed undulating vehicle is a generic class of instruments. See the data set specific information for a detailed description. These are often prototype instrument packages designed to make very specific measurements.

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Gas Chromatograph Instrument Name: Gas Chromatograph Instrument Short Name:Gas Chromatograph Instrument Description: Instrument separating gases, volatile substances, or substances dissolved in a volatile solvent by transporting an inert gas through a column packed with a sorbent to a detector for assay. (from SeaDataNet, BODC) Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB02/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
